clinical_study.brief_title: Glizigen-Viudid-External Anogenital Warts in Children and Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Glizigen-Viudid in the Treatment of External Anogenital Warts in Children and Adolescents.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess the efficacy of Glizigen and Viusid administration in the treatment of external anogenital warts in children and adolescents. The duration of this double-blind placebo controlled phase 3 clinical trial will be 12 weeks. The estimated number of persons to be recruited and randomized for the study is 76. Variables to be assessed will be: time to disappearance of lesions, reduction of the number of lesions and change in the aspect of lesions.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Excellent: Lesion regression before 2 weeks of treatment Good: Lesion regression between 2-5 weeks of treatment Poor: Lesion regression between 5-8 weeks of treatment Bad: No lesion regression after 8 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of adverse effects within the 12 week treatment period
Reduction in the number of lesions
secondary_outcome.description: Excellent: Regression in more than 75% of lesions Good: Regression in 50-75% of lesions Poor: Regression in 25-50% of lesions Bad: Regression in less than 25% of lesions.
Excellent: Lesion regression Poor: Aspect changes from papilloma shaped to flat shaped lesion. Bad: No change in aspect or change from flat shaped to papilloma shaped lesion.

intervention.description: Glizigen (spray, 60 mL bottle with applicator): Dosage commensurate with surface (up to a maximum of 10 cm2) to be treated. From 3 to 5 ambulatory applications (One nebulization corresponds to 2 short pulses). 1 to 3.9 cm2 ______________3 daily applications 4 to 6.9 cm2 ______________4 daily applications 7 to 10 cm2 ______________5 daily applications Treatment will last from 5 days to 8 weeks according to clinical improvement. Viusid (Syrop, 500 mL flask): 12.5 ml every 8 hours for 12 weeks. Viusid syrop should be dissolved in water, fruit juice or milk before ingestion.

Placebo Glizipen (spray, 60 mL bottle with applicator): Dosage commensurate with surface (up to a maximum of 10 cm2) to be treated. Placebo Viusid (Syrop, 500 mL flask): 12.5 ml every 8 hours for 12 weeks. Viusid syrop should be dissolved in water, fruit juice or milk before ingestion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- No previous treatment for anogenital warts
- Negative serology for HB and HIV.
- Signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Treatment with steroids, immune-suppressors, immune-modulators or local or systemic antiviral drugs.
- Hypersensitivity to Glizigen or Viusid:
